t: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
How*p long wilt thou forget me, O Lord?*s for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
How*p long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
Consider*p and hear me, O Lord*s my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
Lest*p mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
But*p I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
I*p will sing unto the Lord,*s because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
